text:
HPI:
   61 yo F p/w OSH c/o facial swelling (?anaphylactic rxn), L sided chest
   pain, found to have L PTX w/ extensive subcutaneous air. Intubated at
   OSH. L-sided chest tube placed. Moved all 4, agitated on arrival to ED.
   +EtOH (39 per OSH).  Head & C-Spine CTs negative.
   Chief complaint:
   s/p fall
   Left PTX
   Left sided rib fractures, 7^th &8^th nondisplaced, lateral
   Respiratory failure
   [**10-4**]: CT TORSO
 TLS Cleared. L rib fxs [**3-17**], 11.  Pneumomediastinum.
   LLL collapse. Adrenal, ovarian, pancreatic & renal hyperdensities that
   may need further f/u in future.
   Trauma, s/p
   Assessment:
   Pt s/p fall at home with multiple L rib fx, L ptx
   Action:
   [**Location (un) 408**] J collar in place, TLS cleared by CT, pt off logroll precautions,
   morphine 4-8mg q 3 hours prn, left CT in place.
   Response:
   Pain well managed with morphine, pt moving about in bed comfortable,
   cdb, is.
   Plan:
   Pain mgmt, IS, CDB, [**Location (un) 408**] J collar.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Pt on cpap with ps, self extubated at 2210.
   Action:
   Pt spontaneously breathing, placed on face mask, O2>95%,.
   Response:
   NARD, sats remain >95%, pt weaned to NC @ 3L.
   Plan:
   Wean O2 as tolerated, encourage cough/deep breathing, IS 10x/hour,
   chest PT.
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Pt with 8/10 left rib pain.
   Action:
   Given 2-4 mg IV Morphine q 2 hours.
   Response:
   Pt reports good pain control with IV morphine.
   Plan:
   Morphine prn.
   Hypertension, malignant (hypertensive crisis, hypertensive emergency)
   Assessment:
   Pt with hx htn, SBP up to 180
   Action:
   Lopressor 10mg q 6, hydralizine 20mg prn.
   Response:
   SBP 140-170
s this shift.
   Plan:
   Goal SBP <165, lopressor/hydralizine prn.
   .H/O alcohol abuse
   Assessment:
   Pt + ETOH on admission, reports [**2-11**] vodka drinks/day.
   Action:
   Pt placed on CIWA scale once extubated.
   Response:
   Rating 0-4.
   Plan:
   CIWA q 1-2 hours, ativan prn.
